subject: Data
title: Heat Maps: Color as Data Language
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Heat Maps: Color as Data Language.

hook.text: A website designer notices users always click the top-left corner. A heat map made the pattern visible.

buildup.text: Heat maps use color intensity to represent data density â€” red for hot spots, blue for cold zones.

discovery.text: They reveal patterns in spatial data that tables can't: crime clusters, website engagement, genetic activity.

twist.text: Color perception varies by person. About 8% of men are colorblind â€” heat maps must be designed carefully.

climax.text: Heat maps let us see density and intensity across surfaces that would be invisible in raw numbers.

punchline.text: Color turns invisible patterns into obvious ones.

quiz.question: What design challenge must heat maps address?
options: Color blindness affecting about 8% of men
